abstract: Death penalty critics, including some survivors of Charleston, SC, church massacre, oppose Justice Dept decision to proceed with capital trial of suspect Dylann S Roof; various objections include Christian belief in forgiveness and worry that lengthy appeals process will hinder survivors' efforts to heal.

keywords.value: Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church (Charleston, SC)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: In the coming trial of Dylann S. Roof, who is accused of killing nine black churchgoers last year, no issue is more disputed than whether he should face execution.
snippet: In the coming trial of Dylann S. Roof, who is accused of killing nine black churchgoers last year, no issue is more disputed than whether he should face execution....

headline.main: U.S. Seeks Death for Charleston Shooting Suspect. Victims’ Families Prefer Mercy.
headline.print_headline: Capital Trial Defies Will of Survivors of Massacre
